Method Detail

main

public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
Main method with which we run the AES algorithm. Usage: java AES e|d [-length] [-mode] keyFile inputFile

Parameters:
args - Array of command line arguments.

subBytes

public void subBytes(int[][] arr)
Replaces all elements in the passed array with values in sbox[][].

Parameters:
arr - Array whose value will be replaced

invSubBytes

public void invSubBytes(int[][] arr)
Inverse rendition of the subBytes. The operations of invSubBytes are the reverse operations of subBytes.

Parameters:
arr - the array that is passed.

shiftRows

public void shiftRows(int[][] arr)
Performs a left shift on each row of the matrix. Left shifts the nth row n-1 times.

Parameters:
arr - the reference of the array to perform the rotations.

invShiftRows

public void invShiftRows(int[][] arr)
Inverse rendition of ShiftRows (this time, right rotations are used).

Parameters:
arr - the array to compute right rotations.

mixColumns

public void mixColumns(int[][] arr)
Performed by mapping each element in the current matrix with the value returned by its helper function.

Parameters:
arr - the array with we calculate against the galois field matrix.

invMixColumns

public int[][] invMixColumns(int[][] arr)

keySchedule

public int[][] keySchedule(java.lang.String key)
The keyScheduling algorithm to expand a short key into a number of separate round keys.

Parameters:
key - the key in which key expansion will be computed upon.
Returns:
the fully computed expanded key for the AES encryption/decryption.

schedule_core

public int[] schedule_core(int[] in,
                           int rconpointer)
For every (binary key size / 32)th column in the expanded key. We compute a special column using sbox and an XOR of the an rcon number with the first element in the passed array.

Parameters:
in - the array in which we compute the next set of bytes for key expansion
rconpointer - the element in the rcon array with which to XOR the first element in 'in'
Returns:
the next column in the key scheduling.

addRoundKey

public void addRoundKey(int[][] bytematrix,
                        int[][] keymatrix)
In the AddRoundKey step, the subkey is combined with the state. For each round, a chunk of the key scheduled is pulled; each subkey is the same size as the state. Each element in the byte matrix is XOR'd with each element in the chunk of the expanded key.

Parameters:
bytematrix - reference of the matrix in which addRoundKey will be computed upon.
keymatrix - chunk of the expanded key

MatrixToString

public static java.lang.String MatrixToString(int[][] m)
ToString() for the matrix (2D array).

Parameters:
m - reference of the matrix
Returns:
the string representation of the matrix.
